wikipedia_page.main: Walter Rice Evans (10 September 1863 – 9 June 1909) was a Welsh international rugby union player, who won three caps between 1890 and 1891.

*Walter Rice Evans (1863–1909), Welsh rugby union player

On 2 January 2000 in an English Cup fixture with Exeter he became the only full Welsh rugby international to represent London Welsh Rugby Football Club either side of the Millennium during the 1999/2000 season.  Photograph of Walter Rice Evans former Oxford Blue and Wales International who shared this distinction in 1899 Reference Article 5 September 1998 "The Independent"
